ContentClassification.TableDescription: 1952 Graduated Rates of Disablement - Benefit 4. Time Period: 2. Elimination Period: 360 days. Minimum Age: 15. Maximum Age: 59
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: The rates of disablement developed in the 1952 Disability Study of the Society of Actuaries (SOA) for Benefit 4 provided for a 120-day waiting period clause (See SOA Table Identity 778). However, by the 1960’s, policies providing disability income benefits were generally based on a 6-month waiting period, thus it was felt that Benefit 4 values should be based on a 6-month waiting period, thereby eliminating the need for subsequent adjustments in net premiums and other values where such waiting period is used. Methodology: Rates developed by formula: rate (6-month) = rate(4-month) * l([x+½]+6/12) / l([x+½]+4/12). In order to eliminate anomalies in results, slight adjustments were made in the figures produced by the aforementioned formula. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 06/2013.
